results:
Based on the search results, I found information about the 1973 Polish television series and film adaptation of "Chłopi" (The Peasants) directed by Jan Rybkowski. Here's what I found:

## "Chłopi" (1973) - Polish Television Series/Film

The Peasants (Polish: Chłopi) is a Polish historical film directed by Jan Rybkowski. It was released in 1973.(no content)It is based on Władysław Reymont's novel of the same name.(no content)A 1972 TV miniseries adaptation was directed by Jan Rybkowski, who also directed the 1973 film adaptation.(no content)This is a film version of the TV series Chłopi from 1972.

### Director and Crew
Jan Rybkowski served as Director (13 Episodes), with Adam Sławiński as Original Music Composer (13 Episodes), and Jan Rybkowski and Ryszard Kosiński as Screenplay writers (13 Episodes).

### Cast
The film starred Władysław Hańcza, Emilia Krakowska, and Krystyna Królówna.

### Plot
Based on the Nobel-prize winning novel by Władysław Reymont, published between 1904-1909, this is a screen adaptation of the story about the Boryna family and other inhabitants of a village in the region of Mazovia in Poland at the turn of the 19th/20th centuries. The Borynas are farmers, and their son is expected to follow the family tradition. But the already touchy relationship of the father and son is strained to the breaking point when both fall in love with the same woman.

The production appears to have been created as both a television miniseries in 1972 and subsequently adapted into a film version in 1973, both directed by Jan Rybkowski.
